chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Wilkinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs remitted.

Court advised defendant on the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Wilkinson

records.addlTxt:
1:27 PM Defendant Robert A. Wilkinson in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Robert A. Wilkinson. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1. Counts 2,3 & 4 DRI. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea. Found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer contrary to 346.04(3). State moves to strike the repeater enhancer. Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: 1 year county jail concurrent to any other potential sentence. There is a  timing issue in regards to the other sentences, nothing for sentence to be concurrent to at this time. 6 month license revocation. 113 days credit. Defense asking consider waiving court costs. 

Court adopts joint recommendation: Imposes 1 year county jail sentence.113 days jail credit. 6 month drivers license revocation. Court costs remitted. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for Plea/sentencing 7/11 @ 1:30

3:28 PM Defendant Robert A. Wilkinson appeared by video, in custody from Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Robert A. Wilkinson. Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.

Waiver of Prelim on May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   Comply with any testing requested by law enforcement.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

12:56 PM Defendant Robert A. Wilkinson appeared by video, in custody from Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bryant Plant appeared specially. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He will contact SPD.  AIA set for 4/11 at 9 am.
